column5: What’s the status of taking fresh produce into Canada? I’m heading up to LOTW at the end of August and thought the resort owner might like some garden grown tomatoes and/or sweet corn.
I'm pretty sure that all fresh vegetables & fruits must be commercially packaged. This way the border guards know the item has been washed and inspected for insects and diseases.

We cross 5-6 times a year at Warroad, on our way to the NWA/LOTW. Always take fresh produce that we have grown or bought at a farm stand. During the winter we take produce we have canned or frozen ourselves. Have never been asked about it and it has never been a problem. We find fresh sweet corn to be especially appreciated. Have a great trip.t
Only potatoes need to be commercially packaged and they need to be labeled USDA #1.Here is the relevant site with the correct information:http://www.inspection.gc.ca/food/inf.../1389648516990Frank
Thanks for the link, Frank. I will double check this before we leave.
